comments:
20020212 (M3 candidate)
NOTE: Linux-Motif (RH 7.0)
I just got the new version of 20020212. (i.e. the second one)
I am using the regular IBM VM.
I created a brand new workspace with nothing in it.
I launched Eclipse using -data to point to my nice new empty workspace.
I was not expecting to have any problems at all, because this is a milestone 
candidate, and because there is no old metadata making potential problems...
so this should have been a clean start.
However, here's what happened:
- I connected to dev.eclipse.org (extssh)
- I turned off autobuild (this is important before loading swt)
- I expanded HEAD in dev.eclipse.org
- I selected org.eclipse.swt project
- I said "Add to workspace"
- I got a dialog saying simply "IO error"
- My workspace's .metadata/.log has the following FileNotFoundException:
Log: Wed Feb 13 10:24:30 EST 2002
4 org.eclipse.vcm.ui 1 Errors adding project
	1=============<children>=============
	4 org.eclipse.vcm.core.cvs 4 IO error
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /bluebird/teamswt/seven/Eclipse/target/org.eclips
e.swt/Eclipse SWT/win32/org/eclipse/swt/graphics/Device.java (Text file busy)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:108)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:68)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:138)

(UpdatedListener.java:77)

I dismissed the dialog and tried "Add to Workspace" again (same project).
This time, it appeared to get a lot further, but same result: "IO error" dialog.
The .log is a bit confusing, however, because it looks like there were 2 
FileNotFound failures this time, one for the same file as before (Device.java) 
and another for another file (Caret.java). Here are the 2 new walkbacks from 
the .log:
